abstract.p: Marc F Bernstein letter holds that Leon Botstein Sept 19 Op-Ed article ignores risks of national education system

block.p: Leon Botstein ignores the risks of a ''national system of education'' (Op-Ed, Sept. 19). Those who create the national standards, curriculums and tests would nullify the benefits of the diverse philosophies and methodologies in American education.

Leon Botstein ignores the risks of a ''national system of education'' (Op-Ed, Sept. 19). Those who create the national standards, curriculums and tests would nullify the benefits of the diverse philosophies and methodologies in American education.

Until now, the well-intentioned errors of any one university or school of thought have been limited to one state or region. Would we have wanted ''new math'' or ''whole language'' to be centrally mandated for all students by a national council?
The states have served the country well as laboratories of exploration, using varied strategies and practices.
MARC F. BERNSTEIN East Hills, N.Y., Sept. 19, 2000
